actions.recommendation: Working on your weight&physical activity will significantly reduce your risk for heart disease.
Managing your diabetes better is also very important for looking after your heart.
Controlling your sugar levels is a priority. You are seeing your GP soon so these results may help him to adjust your medication.
Your DHEA levels are low- this indicates that you are running out of your stress response reserves. You can supplement DHEA, please talk to your GP&psychiatrist.
You need to move as much as possible. Taking time at lunch to go for a walk will have benefits for all of your risk factors as well as improve your mood, energy levels and weight.
Your homocysteine levels: Supplement with methylated vit B's. I recommend you start Methyl care, which you can but form Metagenics (online or in most health stores).
I have referred you for a liver ultrasound to check for a possible fatty liver. We need to see what the cause for the high liver enzymes are. Please take this report to your GP.
